intro: Phainantha shuariorum, commonly known as the Shuarirum phainantha, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in dense rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
